net.extemporal
Interface Platform

public interface Platform

This interface should be implemented to provide storage/retrieval/transmission facilities to the Engine. Note that there are no security requirements imposed by this interface. All that is expected is that the shared secrets (if any) and the temporary key store should remain private to the device/user.
It is up to the implementation to decide how to achieve this. The two test platforms do not take any security precautions at all, though this is not advisable for a production platform.
At the very least, the shared secrets must be kept private, maybe behind a password.

          The key objects used to encrypt/decrypt messages.

Method Detail

retrieveSharedSecret

byte[] retrieveSharedSecret(java.lang.String endpoint,
                            java.lang.Object platformContext)
Parameters:
endpoint - the other party that shares the same secret.
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine. Can be used to enforce a verification scheme
Returns:
a common shared secret with the other party, null if no secret is shared

temporarilyStoreKey

int temporarilyStoreKey(java.lang.Object platformContext,
                        Platform.TemporalKey key,
                        java.lang.String endpoint)
Parameters:
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine
key - the key object to be stored.
endpoint - recipient of the message, for which the key is being used. Will be passed again during retrieval.
Returns:
a reference value that can be used to retrieve the key Note that the security of the key store is entirely up to the Platform implementation. As the name indicates, keys are not expected to be stored for a long time - only until the endpoint responds to our message. So, it is fine to implement a timeout policy suitable for the messaging domain. If a stored key can't be retrieved, the Engine will simply not respond to the received message.

retrieveKey

Platform.TemporalKey retrieveKey(java.lang.Object platformContext,
                                 int reference,
                                 java.lang.String endpoint)
Parameters:
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine
reference - retrieval reference generated by this.temporarilyStoreKey()
endpoint - recipient of the message, for which the key was used. Same value was passed during storage.
Returns:
the retrieved key object Return a key stored previously. AIf a stored key can't be retrieved, the Engine will simply not respond to the received message, and return a failure code from Engine.processReceivedEnvelope()

destroyKey

boolean destroyKey(java.lang.Object platformContext,
                   int reference,
                   java.lang.String endpoint)
Parameters:
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine
reference - retrieval reference generated by this.temporarilyStoreKey()
endpoint - recipient of the message, for which the key was used. Same value was passed during storage.
Returns:
true if the key was found (and destroyed). The stored key will not be used anymore. All references to it should be dropped now.

openReceivedEnvelope

boolean openReceivedEnvelope(java.lang.String from,
                             int commType,
                             Platform.MutablePlatformContext wrapper,
                             boolean verifiable,
                             java.lang.Integer ourRefIfAny,
                             java.lang.Integer theirRefIfAny)
Parameters:
from - sender of the message
commType - type of the message, according to the header. See Engine.flag* constants
wrapper - use this to change the platformContext object, if required. This is the last function guaranteed to be called synchronously after the Engine.processReceivedEnvelope() is used to notify the engine of a new received message. See EmailTestPlatform in test sources for an example.
verifiable - whether the received message has the sender's authentication data in the header.
ourRefIfAny - key store reference, set in case this message is an acknowledgement of a new message from us.
theirRefIfAny - sender's reference. Included for completeness.
Returns:
whether the should proceed with decrypting this message Implement this function to decide when to process a received encrypted message.

transmitBytes

boolean transmitBytes(java.lang.Object platformContext,
                      java.lang.String endpoint,
                      java.nio.ByteBuffer messageBytes)
Parameters:
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine, and possibly changed by openReceivedEnvelope()
endpoint - message destination
messageBytes - message content.
Returns:
whether the bytes were successfully transmitted. Send the message. Note that if messageBytes are encoded as part of the final message, the encoding *must* be loss-less, i.e. UTF-8, UTF-16 etc are no good because some byte sequences do not parse into valid characters.

handleReceivedMessage

boolean handleReceivedMessage(java.lang.Object platformContext,
                              java.lang.String endpoint,
                              java.nio.ByteBuffer messagePlainBytes)
Parameters:
platformContext - context object passed to the Engine, and possibly changed by openReceivedEnvelope()
endpoint - message sender
messagePlainBytes - decrypted message content.
Returns:
whether the message was successfully handled. Final method called by the Engine on the recipient platform. Passes the decrypted message content to this platform.

executeAsynchronously

void executeAsynchronously(java.lang.Runnable function)
Parameters:
function - a task to execute asynchronously Called by the engine to execute long-running tasks (e.g. sending of a message)

getTypeIdentifier

byte getTypeIdentifier()
Returns:
a character identifying this platform. Included in the header, though not currently used for any validation.

processException

void processException(java.lang.Exception e)
Parameters:
e - exception object Handle any exceptions thrown while processing a message
